metadata.dc:author: Amigó Tadín, Montserrat
metadata.dc:description: Alcohol is a socially accepted drug which is commercialized in multiple products including wine, cognac, gin, beer, anisette, vermouth, rum, etc. and which can be consumed in small quantities without producing harmful effects on one's health; nonetheless, women are more susceptible to alcohol's damages and an abusive consumption of alcohol creates dependence and chronic diseases. Ten percent of those people who consume alcohol develop dependency and comprise the leading group of drug addicts in many countries.
metadata.dc:title: Dependencia al alcohol.
[Drugs, a current problem. Alcohol dependency].
